definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: I've been as busy as a bee all day doing my spring - cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 大扫除使得我一整天一直忙得不可开交。

sentences.english: She keeps after her boyfriend all day long and he can't bear it any more.
sentences.chinese: 她整天都在与她的男朋友争吵，他没法再忍受下去了。

sentences.english: Playing computer games all day lavishes parents' hard-earned money.
sentences.chinese: 整天玩电脑游戏浪费父母的血汗钱。

sentences.english: How much does the all-day tour cost?
sentences.chinese: 整天的旅游费要多少钱？

sentences.english: If I wanted to I could just be a couch potato for days on end.
sentences.chinese: 要是我愿意的话可以整天做只懒虫就行。

sentences.english: He can keep high-spirited selling products in chills for the whole day.
sentences.chinese: 他能一整天都站在寒风里精力充沛地销售产品。

sentences.english: My legs felt weak after a day of running around.
sentences.chinese: 一整天四处奔走之后我的腿软了。

sentences.english: He was sawing all day and finally sawed the tree down.
sentences.chinese: 他锯了一整天，最终把树锯倒了。

sentences.english: It fights obesity, diabetes, and heart disease all day.
sentences.chinese: 早餐整天都与肥胖症，糖尿病，心脏病做斗争。

sentences.english: This doesn’t mean that you should sit on your couch all day.
sentences.chinese: 当然这并不意味着你应该整天坐在沙发上无所事事。

sentences.english: We shall be there at 9a. m and enjoy a full day there.
sentences.chinese: 我们要早晨9点到那里在那里玩一整天。

sentences.english: Last Saturday, Kevin put things in boxes all day. He went to bed very late that night.
sentences.chinese: 上星期日，克文整天放东西到箱子里，他那晚很晚睡。

sentences.english: If you want to appear smarter, hang aroud someone stupider.
sentences.chinese: 要想显得聪明，整天和笨人呆在一起。

sentences.english: Brown has been yelling at me all day.
sentences.chinese: 他今天一整天对谁都是又吼又叫的。

sentences.english: I can't come into Hogsmeade at all, Angelina wants a full day's training.
sentences.chinese: 我去不了霍格莫德，安吉利娜要训练一整天。

sentences.english: My boss is a stuffed shirt, bragging all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我的老板神气十足，整天在吹嘘。

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
to leave early and return late (idiom)
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
the whole night/all through the night
